issue.title: [CF 800] Unit cooldown lua error
issue.body:
5x IconTypes\IconType_unitcooldown\unitcooldown.lua:270: attempt to index local "NameHash" (a boolean value)
IconTypes\IconType_unitcooldown\unitcooldown.lua:270: in function "?"
libs\CallbackHandler-1.0\CallbackHandler-1.0-6.lua:147: in function <libs\CallbackHandler-1.0\CallbackHandler-1.0.lua:147>
<string>:"safecall Dispatcher[15]":4: in function <string>:"safecall Dispatcher[15]":4
<in C code>
<string>:"safecall Dispatcher[15]":13: in function "?"
libs\CallbackHandler-1.0\CallbackHandler-1.0-6.lua:92: in function "Fire"
Bagnon-5.2.4\libs\AceEvent-3.0\AceEvent-3.0-3.lua:52: in function <Bagnon\libs\AceEvent-3.0\AceEvent-3.0.lua:51>

Locals:
nil


> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl | Imported from CurseForge issue #800 | Raw

comments.body:
wtf. I don't even know how this is possible. I will have to take a look when I get home.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

If you can isolate the export string of an icon that will reliably cause this error, could you post it? All normal laws of physics, programming, and Lua are telling me that this error should not be happening.

Actually, the export string of your whole profile is what I need.

Edited Apr 25, 2013

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Just looked through the change logs and saw that I have fixed this error back in version 6.0.4 too. I guessing that I didn't actually fix it.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Right-Click a new icon, choose the Unit Cooldown, change the icon type to Combat Event, cast a spell, you will see that lua error.


> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl

Couldn't reproduce, but now I know wtf was happening. Should be fixed in r792.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Fixed in r792.


> Posted by CurseForge user lsjyzjl
